On February 29, we're holding our Centennial Celebration at the National Constitution Center!
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

You're invited to the ACLU Centennial Celebration Philly!

Join us for an extraordinary occasion as we celebrate the organization dedicated to defending civil liberties for all as it launches into its second century.

Saturday, February 29, 2020
at the National Constitution Center
525 Arch St, Philadelphia, PA 19106


Purchase Tickets

Purchase Sponsorship

Sponsor Reception: 6 p.m.
Main Event, Cocktails and Dinner: 6:30 p.m.
Program and Award Ceremony: 8:15 p.m.
Dessert and Dancing: 9:15 p.m.

We the People Honoree
Nikole Hannah-Jones, New York Times reporter and creator of the "1619 Project"
Featured Entertainment
J.S. Ondara
The Philadelphia Gay Men's Chorus

Honorary Hosts
Viviette Applewhite, Mark A. Aronchick, Karl Baker and Judith Bernstein-Baker, Burton Caine, Fernando Chang-Muy and Len and Isabel Rieser, James D. Crawford, Lawrence Felzer, Peter Goldberger, Jane Golden, Deborah R. Gross, Mel Heifetz, Amber Hikes, Malcolm Jenkins, Arthur M. Kaplan, Edward M. Posner, Anne Rosewater and Robert Kronley, Judy Wicks.

Wendy Meyer, Chair

Mathewson, Will McEnroe, Kathy Ochroch, Carl Peridier, Amer Sajed, Liz Schultz, Eli Segal, Paul Steinke, Bill Warren, Tom Wilson Weinberg, Judy Weinstein.
